name: Reed Salazar
core_wound: Watched his younger brother work himself to death at 25, three jobs trying to pay off medical debt, system killed him and called it 'opportunity'
wants: Initially nothing - just to get through each day. Later: to see if people can be happy without struggle.
needs: To believe his brother's death meant something, that the system can be proven wrong
contradiction: Nihilistic but can't stop caring, claims not to hope but keeps taking action, says he's given up but hasn't
physical_description: Latino, thin from years of poor nutrition and drug use, permanent bags under eyes, tattoos from before he gave up on life, by his 40s looks gaunt and sick but eyes are sharper than ever
skills: Small-scale drug dealing and black market navigation
Understanding of financial systems from his pre-dealer life
Surprisingly good with data and analysis
flaws: Leveler addiction throughout, functional but dependent
Difficulty accepting he matters to people
Self-isolation even when people try to connect
knowledge_state_book1_start: Corporate systems from working in them before
Nothing about economics or social organizing

relationships.Dr. Amara Osei: Sociologist studying his experiment, becomes collaborator and maybe love interest
relationships.The Community: Anonymous benefactor they debate and mythologize, doesn't realize how much they need him
relationships.Corporate Board: Faceless enemy until they become very interested in stopping him
relationships.His dead brother: Haunted by him, everything he does is for Marco
